New Records: Luis Gil allowed just one earned run over five innings, striking out five batters.
Juan Soto broke out of his slump with a 402-foot two-run home run in the sixth inning.
Austin Wells delivered a crucial pinch-hit sacrifice fly in the 10th inning to tie the game at 3-3.
Key Match Events: The Yankees won the game in the bottom of the 10th inning with Jazz Chisholm's groundout to shortstop for the winning run.
Juan Soto's two-run home run in the sixth inning was a turning point.
Austin Wells' pinch-hit sacrifice fly in the 10th inning was a key moment in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz Chisholm expressed excitement about the win, stating it was'sick' despite it not being October yet.
The victory extended the Yankees' lead in the American League East to 1.5 games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees will face the Boston Red Sox in a pivotal four-game series starting on Thursday night.
Manager Aaron Boone relied on Luis Gil's strong performance in the game.
